definition: to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
low/beneath/to lower (one's head)/to let droop/to hang down/to incline

sentences.english: Please lower your brows and draw them together.
sentences.chinese: 請放低你的眉毛，將他們擰在一起。

sentences.english: It lifted its head and then lowered it.
sentences.chinese: 它先昂起了頭然後又把腦袋放低了。

sentences.english: Her voice thinned down to a whisper as people turned to shush her.
sentences.chinese: 當人們回過頭來噓她時，她就放低嗓門講話了。

sentences.english: Leave the handle down so that the child can open it.
sentences.chinese: 將把手放低，這樣孩子可以打開它。

sentences.english: So keep your hands low and ask for more bend to stretch the soreness out of his muscles.
sentences.chinese: 將手放低，要求更多的屈撓以拉伸痠疼的肌肉。

sentences.english: Beginning with either your right or left arm, slowly lower your arm back toward your head.
sentences.chinese: 開始先將右側或左側上肢緩慢地向後朝頭部放低。

sentences.english: To learn new things, to continue to progress, it is necessary to put their own posture.
sentences.chinese: 要學會新東西，要不斷進步，就必須放低自己的姿勢。

sentences.english: Release the brake and lower it to the boat deck.
sentences.chinese: 鬆開剎車，把它放低到船甲板。

sentences.english: Now, put your baby finger on the first modifier you can find.
sentences.chinese: 現在，放低嬰兒手指的修飾你可以找到首。

sentences.english: He didn't bother himself to lower his voice.
sentences.chinese: 他連聲音都沒放低一點。
就必須放低自己的姿勢。

sentences.english: The soldier depressed the muzzle of a gun.
I really wish she can keep her voices down.
sentences.chinese: 我真希望她能把嗓門放低些。

definition: to lay down/to put down/to let go of/to relinquish/to set aside/to lower (the blinds etc)
to exhale/to blow off steam/(phonetics) aspirated
to move (sth) aside/to step aside/to move over (when sitting on a bench)/to shift (one's gaze)
to approach/to get close to/to sneak up on/near to
tone/note/a tone (on a Chinese syllable)/CL:個|个[ge4]
